# arrange(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a given array, appropriately sorted and filtered.

## Declaration

```swift
func arrange(_ objects: [Any]) -> [Any]
```

## Return Value

An array containing `objects` filtered using the receiver’s filter predicate (see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSArrayController/filterPredicate]) and sorted according to the receiver’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSArrayController/sortDescriptors].

## Discussion

Subclasses should override this method to use a different sort mechanism, provide custom object arrangement, or (typically only prior to OS X version 10.4, which provides a filter predicate) filter the objects.

## Arranging Objects

- **arrangedObjects**: An array containing the receiver’s content objects arranged using [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSArrayController/arrange(_:)].
- **rearrangeObjects()**: Triggers filtering of the receiver’s content.
